name: CGPACK
short_description:
Cgpack is a Fortran 2008 library for simulating polycrystalline formation, deformation and fracture. The library uses coarrays and is suitable for HPC use. It has been used on HECToR and ARCHER, the UK national supercomputers, with linear scaling up to 32k cores and 25% parallel efficiency.

The other project page:
http://eis.bris.ac.uk/~mexas/cgpack/

Fully hyperlinked src, produced by ROBOdoc:
http://eis.bris.ac.uk/~mexas/cgpack/src/toc_index.html
summary: Polycrystalline evolution simulation library in Fortran 2008 coarrays

screenshots.caption: The cracks on {100} crystallographic planes are shown in yellow, and those on {110} planes are in green.
A view of cracks through semi-transparent network of crystal boundaries.
The crystal boundaries in iron are shown in purple.
